column1: The next night Grendel came again and levied his second tribute
column2: and again there was mourning and desolation in the land. Thus for twelve years the monster giant came at intervals and carried away many of the noblest in the kingdom. Then were there empty homes everywhere in the land
column3: and sorrow and suffering came where joy and peace had rested. Strange as it may seem
column5: though he sat the night long watching his nobles as they slept in the mead-hall
column6: hoping himself to deliver them from the awful power that harassed them. But night after night Grendel came
column7: and while Hrothgar remained unharmed he was equally powerless to stay the ravages of the giant. Hrothgar bowed his head in sorrow and prayed to his gods to send help before all his noble vassals perished.
